comments.body:
I opened a PR to include the license file in the source distribution:
https://github.com/python-control/python-control/pull/150

Please then in a comment in the `meta.yaml` reference the PR. 

My reading of the BSD license suggests that we should manually package a copy of the license until it's fixed upstream:

http://conda-forge.github.io/docs/meta.html#packaging-the-license-manually
I don't even see a license in the source tree at all: https://github.com/python-control/python-control/tree/0.7.0
It looks like the files have the license embedded, e.g. https://github.com/python-control/python-control/blob/0.7.0/control/bdalg.py

I think that the code included in this conda package is sufficient. It copies exactly what the authors of the package distribute on PyPi. I'm not sure why they chose to distribute it like this but I wouldn't feel comfortable creating a license file for 0.7.0 and putting in this package. Once they release a new version with the license this can be updated. I'd prefer to merge as is.
